No Audible Release.desc: Checked Tone / 入聲 (lit. "Entering Tone") is a feature that present in Old Chinese.

Voiced Consonants.desc: Voiced consonants presents in Old Chinese. Some mordern Chinese languages have voiced consonats devoiced.

Literary and colloquial readings.desc: 文白異讀 (lit. "Literary and colloquial differnt pronunciation). Some Chinese characters are pronounced literarily for loanwords, proper nouns, formal contexts, and colloquially for casual speech.

Reduced Diphthong.desc: Some languages have reduced diphthon because of assimilation or other reasons.

No-Palatalization.desc: Some sounds become palatalized in some Mordern Chinese languages. In contradiction, Old Chinese has palatalized and non-palatalized distinction.

Post-Verb Adv..desc: In some languages the adverb is placed differntly than majority of languagees.

Post-Noun Adj..desc: In some languages the adjective is placed differntly than majority of languagees.
